core_roles.description: The entity performing the pouring action.
core_roles.example: The chef pours water into the glass.
The chef pours water into the glass.

core_roles.description: The target or receptacle into which the substance is poured.
core_roles.example: The chef pours water into the glass.

core_roles.description: The tool or container used to pour the substance.
core_roles.example: The chef pours water from the pitcher into the glass.

peripheral_roles.description: The initial location or container holding the substance.
peripheral_roles.example: The chef pours water from the pitcher into the glass.

peripheral_roles.description: The way in which the pouring action is performed.
peripheral_roles.example: The chef pours water slowly into the glass.

peripheral_roles.description: The amount or volume of the substance poured.
peripheral_roles.example: The chef pours half a glass of water.

peripheral_roles.description: The time when the pouring action occurs.
peripheral_roles.example: The chef pours water in the morning.

peripheral_roles.description: The location where the pouring action occurs.
peripheral_roles.example: The chef pours water into the glass on the kitchen counter.

additional_roles.description: The reason or motivation for the pouring action.
additional_roles.example: The chef pours water to prepare tea.

additional_roles.description: The outcome or effect of the pouring action.
additional_roles.example: The glass is filled with water.

additional_roles.description: A secondary entity assisting in the pouring action.
additional_roles.example: The chef and the assistant pour drinks together.
